context: Global technology company with distributed teams across 15 countries evaluating comprehensive remote work strategy to improve productivity, reduce costs, and enhance employee satisfaction following successful pilot program

request.purpose: Implement global remote work infrastructure, tools, and policies for 60% of workforce
request.justification: Pilot showed 25% productivity increase, 30% cost savings on office space, and 40% improvement in employee satisfaction; competitors offering flexible work are attracting top talent

decision_process.outcome: Pilot demonstrated clear benefits with measurable ROI
Strong stakeholder support with identified concerns addressed

business_impact.expected_outcome: 25% productivity improvement, 30% reduction in real estate costs, 40% increase in employee retention, access to global talent pool, enhanced company reputation as progressive employer
risk_factors: Data security concerns with distributed workforce
Manager capability gaps in remote leadership
Potential loss of company culture and collaboration

lessons_learned: Comprehensive pilot testing and stakeholder engagement critical for successful enterprise remote work implementation; cultural adaptation and technology infrastructure must be addressed simultaneously
